just the usual auto-updates
cat /proc/scsi/scsi  <-- anythign there?

weird... can you open/close the drive physically?
yep.
how often have you rebooted the system since this started to occur, rougly?
have you tried reseating the cd drive?
reseating?

yes, as in, turning the system off, unplugging the power, pulling the battery, pulling the drive out of the unit, using canned air to clear out any dust, then putting it back in and booting it up again
eck, Ive never tried opening my laptop :(
ack... it shouldn't be too difficult
hmm, I'm going to try it out in Windows first I guess (this is a dual boot system) and see if it works there too.
but yeah, if you've never done it before... see if you can reboot with an ubuntu cd
see if it will boot it
would that be equally effective than trying to boot from it? btw, GRUB used to pause when it sees there's a cd in the drive. now it doesn't.
try that out first
